meanings.sent1: The agglutinogenic substance made the blood cells stick together.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the agglutinogenic properties of the new chemical compound.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinogenic glue worked so well that even the strongest materials couldn't be separated.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an agglutinogenic force, bringing people together in unity.
meanings.sent5: The agglutinogenic effect of the magnet was so strong that it attracted all nearby metal objects.

meanings.sent1: The agglutinogenic reaction was observed under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine contained an agglutinogenic component to trigger the immune response.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinogenic power of the chef's secret sauce made all the ingredients stick together perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was agglutinogenic, bringing diverse individuals together for a common goal.
meanings.sent5: The agglutinogenic nature of the enzyme allowed it to bind different molecules efficiently.
